alert.note: Alert for Mercer (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Clinton, Rock Island and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Clinton and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Lee, Henderson, Hancock and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess, Clinton and Carroll Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Boston LD17. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.1 feet, Lock and Dam 17 is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to 19.3 feet Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 10/02/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
